main_definition: To steal or take property unlawfully from a person or place.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove money directly from a bank, ATM, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The thief attempted to rob the bank by hacking into its security system.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take something forcefully or without permission.
meanings_and_examples.example: The burglars robbed the house while its residents were away on vacation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To deprive someone of their belongings by taking them against their will.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the civil unrest, many shops were robbed, leaving owners with nothing but broken windows and stolen goods.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom meaning to take advantage of a situation or opportunity without regard for others.
meanings_and_examples.example: By jumping the queue at the store, he made sure not to be rob anyone else in line.
